newsitem.title: USA: World market price for upland cotton - USDA.
newsitem.headline: World market price for upland cotton - USDA.

text.p: USDA announced the prevailing world market price for upland cotton at 66.28 cents per lb, effective through midnight ET on May 29.
The price is adjusted to U.S. quality allocation for Strict Low Middling, 1-1/16 inch upland cotton.

Because the AWP is above the 1995 and 1996 base quality loan rate of 51.92 cts per lb, the loan repayment rate is equal to the loan rate, adjusted for the specific quality and location plus applicable interest and storage charges.
This week, Step 2 payments are prohibited because the current USNE price has not exceeded the current NE price by more than 1.25 cents per pound for four consecutive weeks, USDA said.
